meanings.definition: Not characteristic of a man; lacking qualities traditionally associated with masculinity.
meanings.sent1: Her unmannish behavior surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: He felt uncomfortable wearing the pink shirt, as it seemed unmannish to him.
meanings.sent3: The tough biker tried to act unmannish by sipping tea delicately.
meanings.sent4: His unmannish love for flower arranging raised eyebrows among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The image of a burly lumberjack knitting was truly unmannish.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a way that is not typical of a man; effeminate.
meanings.sent1: His unmannish gestures made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The actor's unmannish portrayal of the character received mixed reviews.
meanings.sent3: The wrestler's attempt at ballet was comically unmannish.
meanings.sent4: In the world of competitive sports, his unmannish approach was a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's unmannish sensitivity towards others was admirable.
